diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Addison's disease was supported by the presence of chronic weakness, fatigue, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, dizziness, muscle and joint pains, hyperpigmentation, hypotension, hyponatremia, and hyperkalemia. Notably, laboratory findings indicated adrenal insufficiency with undetectable plasma cortisol levels, elevated plasma corticotropin levels, and possible associations with the patient's known celiac disease and family history of autoimmune disorders.
